Title: 1. Lawrence of Arabia
description: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.

Title: 2. Dr. No
description: A resourceful British government agent seeks answers in a case involving the disappearance of a colleague and the disruption of the American space program.

Title: 3. The Manchurian Candidate
description: An American POW in the Korean War is brainwashed as an unwitting assassin for an international Communist conspiracy.

Title: 4. To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A widowed lawyer in Depression-era Alabama defends a black man against a false rape charge while teaching his young children about the sad reality of prejudice.

Title: 5. Mafioso
description: When a good-natured factory supervisor living in Milan with his Northern wife returns to his native Sicily, a decades'-old oath forces him to fulfill a nightmarish obligation.

Title: 6. The Trial
description: An unassuming office worker is arrested and stands trial, but he is never made aware of his charges.

Title: 7. Le Doulos
description: A burglar betraying other criminals prepares for a big heist with a trusted friend who might be as untrustworthy as he.

Title: 8. How the West Was Won
description: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the 19th century, including the Gold Rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads.

Title: 9. Le combat dans l'île
description: After an unsuccessful assassination, a terrorist and his wife hide on a remote island in the house of a friend who doesn't suspect anything.

Title: 10. Sanjuro
description: A crafty samurai helps a young man and his fellow clansmen trying to save his uncle, who has been framed and imprisoned by a corrupt superintendent.

Title: 11. Vivre sa vie
description: Twelve episodic tales in the life of a Parisian woman and her slow descent into prostitution.

Title: 12. Ivan's Childhood
description: During WWII, Soviet orphan Ivan Bondarev strikes up a friendship with three sympathetic Soviet officers while working as a scout behind the German lines.

Title: 13. A Kind of Loving
description: After his girlfriend's pregnancy forces him to marry her, a young man must adjust to his new life and contend with his domineering mother-in-law.

Title: 14. Jules and Jim
description: Decades of a love triangle concerning two friends and an impulsive woman.

Title: 15. What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?
description: A former vaudeville child star torments her paraplegic sister, who eclipsed her as a movie star, in their decaying Hollywood mansion while desperately clinging to hopes of a comeback.

Title: 16. Lolita
description: A middle-aged college professor becomes infatuated with a 14-year-old girl.

Title: 17. Harakiri
description: When a ronin requesting seppuku at a feudal lord's palace is told of the brutal suicide of another ronin who previously visited, he reveals how their pasts are intertwined - and in doing so challenges the clan's integrity.

Title: 18. The Creation of the Humanoids
description: In a post holocaust society, robots take it on their own to help the dying human race by giving them android bodies.

Title: 19. The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
description: A senator returns to a Western town for the funeral of an old friend and tells the story of his origins.

Title: 20. The Miracle Worker
description: The story of Anne Sullivan's struggle to teach the blind, deaf and mute child Helen Keller how to understand and communicate.

Title: 21. The Music Man
description: Traveling con artist Harold Hill targets the naïve residents of a small town in 1910s Iowa by posing as a boys' band leader to raise money before he can skip town.

Title: 22. The Longest Day
description: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.

Title: 23. Cléo from 5 to 7
description: Cleo, a singer and hypochondriac, becomes increasingly worried that she might have cancer while awaiting test results from her doctor.

Title: 24. Cape Fear
description: A lawyer's family is stalked by a man he once helped put in jail.

Title: 25. Mutiny on the Bounty
description: In 1787, British ship Bounty leaves Portsmouth to bring a cargo of bread-fruit from Tahiti, but the savage on-board conditions imposed by Captain Bligh trigger a mutiny led by first officer Fletcher Christian.

Title: 26. Carnival of Souls
description: After a traumatic accident, a woman becomes drawn to a mysterious abandoned carnival.

Title: 27. The 300 Spartans
description: A small Army of Greeks spearheaded by three hundred Spartans do battle with the whole invading Persian Army.

Title: 28. L'Eclisse
description: A young woman meets a vital young man, but their love affair is doomed because of the man's materialistic nature.

Title: 29. Hatari!
description: A group of men trap wild animals in Africa and sell them to zoos before the arrival of a female wildlife photographer threatens to change their ways.

Title: 30. Birdman of Alcatraz
description: A surly convicted murderer held in permanent isolation redeems himself when he becomes a renowned bird expert.

Title: 31. The Exterminating Angel
description: The guests at an upper-class dinner party find themselves unable to leave.

Title: 32. Days of Wine and Roses
description: An alcoholic marries a young woman and systematically addicts her to booze so that they can share his "passion" together.

Title: 33. Boccaccio '70
description: Inspired by Boccaccio's novellas, each episode focuses on sex, love and seduction in Italy in the 1960s, an era of economic growth and major cultural changes.

Title: 34. Ride the High Country
description: An ex-union soldier is hired to transport gold from a mining community through dangerous territory. But what he doesn't realize is that his partner and old friend is plotting to double-cross him.

Title: 35. Jack the Giant Killer
description: A farmboy-turned-knight must protect a princess from the schemes of an evil wizard.

Title: 36. The War Lover
description: In 1943, while stationed in Britain, arrogant Captain Buzz Rickson is in command of a Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress bomber, but his recklessness is endangering everyone around him.

Title: 37. Gypsy
description: Based on the Broadway hit about the life and times of burlesque dancer Gypsy Rose Lee and her aggressive stage mother, Mama Rose.

Title: 38. That Touch of Mink
description: A rich businessman and a young woman are attracted to each other, but he only wants an affair while she wants to save herself for marriage.

Title: 39. Crooks Anonymous
description: Infamous thief attempts reformation through 12-step program led by former criminal to marry girlfriend. His job as department store Santa tests his resolve for change.

Title: 40. Walk on the Wild Side
description: Poor lovesick white-trash Dove Linkhorn arrives in New Orleans searching for his former girlfriend Hallie Gerard, an artist who works in The Doll House brothel, whose madam Jo Courtney considers her girls to be her property.

Title: 41. A Dog's Life
description: A "shockumentary" consisting of a collection of mostly real archive footage displaying mankind at its most depraved and perverse, displaying bizarre rites, cruel behavior and bestial violence.

Title: 42. Knife in the Water
description: A couple pick up a hitchhiker on the way to their yacht. The husband invites the young man to come along for their day's sailing. As the voyage progresses, the antagonism between the two men grows. A violent confrontation is inevitable.

Title: 43. Taras Bulba
description: In the 16th-century Ukraine, the Polish overlords and Ukrainian cossacks fight for control of the land but frequent Turkish invasions force them to unite against the common Turkish foe.

Title: 44. Sweet Bird of Youth
description: A drifter and a faded film star, both traumatized by Hollywood, arrive to the guy's hometown, where the old bitter memories revive again.

Title: 45. Long Day's Journey Into Night
description: At the end of a long and hot summer day, members of one family gather in a large house. Everyone has something painful and offensive to say, and their silence is even worse.

Title: 46. The Magic Sword
description: The son of a sorceress, armed with weapons, armour and six magically summoned knights, embarks on a quest to save a princess from a vengeful wizard.

Title: 47. Follow That Dream
description: A family of ragtag vagabonds sets up a makeshift home on a Florida beach after becoming marooned there, prompting an uptight local bureaucrat to attempt to evict them.

Title: 48. Mamma Roma
description: An ex-prostitute reunites with her son, but an extortion scheme threatens her aspirations for a decent life.

Title: 49. Sodom and Gomorrah
description: Sex, torture, and betrayal in Biblical Sodom and Gomorrah. Lot, leader of the Hebrews, believes that his people can co-exist with the Sodomites--a disastrous decision.

Title: 50. Carry on Cruising
description: Aboard cruise ship SS Happy Wanderer, Capt. Crowther faces incompetent replacements for crew like cook, doctor, officer. Passengers turn out bizarre too, compounding Crowther's frustrations as voyage progresses.

Title: 51. Wild Gals of the Naked West
description: An old geezer recalls some of the antics of the men and women of his Western town, which was more wild and woolly than Tombstone or Dodge City. In this town, no one is a good shot, the women are hungry for new meat, and practical jokers abound. A stranger strolls into town and proves resistant to the mayhem. After donning some cowboy duds he starts to clean up the town.

Title: 52. Girls! Girls! Girls!
description: When he finds out his boss is retiring to Arizona, a sailor has to find a way to buy the Westwind, a boat that he and his father built. He is also caught between two women: insensitive club singer Robin and sweet Laurel.

Title: 53. King Kong vs. Godzilla
description: The advertising director of a pharmaceutical company seeks to boost the ratings of their sponsored TV program by capturing the legendary monster King Kong just as Godzilla re-emerges.

Title: 54. The Phantom of the Opera
description: An acid-scarred composer has his dwarf helper bring an opera singer to his London sewer hide-out.

Title: 55. Two for the Seesaw
description: Robert Wise directs Robert Mitchum and Shirley MacLaine in this spicy and poignant love story about a free-spirited Greenwich Village girl who hooks up with a brooding Nebraska lawyer. In HD.

Title: 56. Il sorpasso
description: An impulsive braggart takes a shy law student with him for a two-day road trip from Rome to Tuscany.

Title: 57. In Search of the Castaways
description: In 19th century England, young Mary Grant and her brother, Robert, embark on a dangerous quest to find their missing father, a sea captain who vanished somewhere along the Chilean coast.

Title: 58. Experiment in Terror
description: A man with an asthmatic voice telephones and assaults clerk Kelly Sherwood at home and coerces her into helping him steal a large sum from her bank.

Title: 59. The Notorious Landlady
description: An American junior diplomat in London rents a house from, and falls in love with, a woman suspected of murder.

Title: 60. The Counterfeit Traitor
description: Blacklisted in modern day WW2, a Swedish oil trader opts to assist British Allies, by means of infiltrating and surveying Nazi Germany.

Title: 61. Mr. Hobbs Takes a Vacation
description: Mr. Hobbs wants to spend a quiet holiday at the beach, but his wife has invited all their family to stay with them.

Title: 62. Lonely Are the Brave
description: A fiercely independent cowboy gets himself locked up in prison to escape with an old friend.

Title: 63. The Chapman Report
description: The lives of four women, each dealing with different sexual struggles, from frigidity to nymphomania. A researcher becomes entangled with a young woman struggling with emotional frigidity.

Title: 64. David and Lisa
description: Teenager David Clemens develops a hysterical fear that he will die if he comes into physical contact with another person. Perturbed, David's overbearing mother places him in a home for mentally disturbed young people.

Title: 65. The Amorous Mr. Prawn
description: General and Lady Fitzadam live at a remote army outpost in Scotland, their last assignment before the General retires. The General is sent abroad and in his absence, Lady Fitzadam decides to convert their spacious estate into a fishing resort for American tourists.

Title: 66. The Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse
description: In Argentina, one daughter of patriarch Madariaga is married to a Frenchman while the other is married to a German, thus leading to a crisis when Nazi Germany occupies France and some Madariaga family members fight on opposite sides.

Title: 67. The Brain That Wouldn't Die
description: A doctor experimenting with transplant techniques keeps his girlfriend's head alive when she is decapitated in a car crash, then goes hunting for a new body.

Title: 68. Billy Budd
description: When a kind-hearted sailor is made to join an English vessel at war in 1797, he finds himself caught between devotion to his crewmates and obedience to their hated, cruel master-at-arms.

Title: 69. An Autumn Afternoon
description: An aging widower arranges a marriage for his only daughter.

Title: 70. Kid Galahad
description: After completing his military service, Walter Gulick takes a job as a sparring partner at a gym, the owner of which sees potential in Walter as a professional fighter and takes him under his wing.

Title: 71. Tonight for Sure
description: On a club stage reality and fiction are mixed.

Title: 72. Advise & Consent
description: The polarizing search for a new Secretary of State has far-reaching consequences.

Title: 73. The Interns
description: Medical drama that focuses on the personal and professional conflicts of medical interns working under senior surgeons at a major hospital.

Title: 74. The Wonderful World of the Brothers Grimm
description: The story of Wilhelm and Jacob Grimm, and three of their stories.

Title: 75. Panic in Year Zero!
description: A family leaves Los Angeles for a camping trip just before hydrogen bombs destroy the city. In the midst of the chaos, the father must fight to keep his family alive along the highway.

Title: 76. The Loneliness of the Long Distance Runner
description: A young thief takes up long-distance running when he is sent to a borstal.

Title: 77. Son of Flubber
description: When Professor Brainard experiments further on Flubber derivatives, he gets in trouble and only his students can help.

Title: 78. Hell Is for Heroes
description: Small squad must hold off German attack.

Title: 79. Night Creatures
description: In 18th-century England, the Royal Crown sends Royal Navy Captain Collier and his crew to investigate reports of illegal smuggling and bootlegging in a coastal town where locals believe in Marsh Phantoms.

Title: 80. The Tale of Zatoichi
description: The adventures of a blind, gambling masseur who also happens to be a master swordsman.

Title: 81. House on Bare Mountain
description: The Wolfman, Dracula and Frankenstein spy on a girls' school in the mountains, where most of the girls spend their time sunbathing in the nude, nude exercises and nude art classes. The monsters finally invade the school...

Title: 82. Five Weeks in a Balloon
description: In 1862, the British commission inventor Fergusson to claim uncharted land in West Africa for Britain by flying his giant hot air balloon there.

Title: 83. The Intruder
description: A charismatic "social reformer" rallies the white populace of a Southern town to oppose school integration, but he soon finds himself in a situation that he cannot control.

Title: 84. Jigsaw
description: A woman is found murdered in a house along the coast from Brighton. Local detectives Fellows and Wilks lead an investigation methodically following up leads and clues mostly in Brighton and Hove but also further afield.

Title: 85. The Fabulous Baron Munchausen
description: The outrageous Baron Munchausen tells of his many adventures, from meeting the Man in the Moon to defeating a Turkish army all by himself.

Title: 86. All Night Long
description: This movie, based on William Shakespeare's Othello, is neatly positioned as a vehicle to showcase some of the best jazz musicians of the period, including Dave Brubeck and Charles Mingus.

Title: 87. Geronimo
description: In 1880s Arizona, General Crook and his troops are trying to subdue the last tribe of Apache led by Geronimo.

Title: 88. The Horrible Dr. Hichcock
description: In 1897 London, a woman weds a necrophiliac doctor whose first wife died under mysterious circumstances - and who might be returning from the grave to torment her successor.

Title: 89. Freud
description: An examination of Czech-Austrian psychologist Sigmund Freud's career when he began to treat patients diagnosed with hysteria, using the radical technique of hypnosis.

Title: 90. Eegah
description: Teenagers stumble across a prehistoric caveman who goes on a rampage.

Title: 91. Tower of London
description: The twisted Richard III is haunted by the ghosts of those he has murdered in his attempt to become the King of England.

Title: 92. Tales of Terror
description: Three tales of terror involve a grieving widower and the daughter he abandoned; a drunkard and his wife's black cat; and a hypnotist who prolongs the moment of a man's death.

Title: 93. Live Now - Pay Later
description: Albert is a cheerful, unscrupulous "tally-man", a door-to-door salesman who cons housewives into buying things they don't need on the installment plan. He's happy - until he begins to fall in love.

Title: 94. Night of the Eagle
description: A woman who may be a witch defends her husband from forces attempting to harm him.

Title: 95. The Damned
description: An American tourist, a youth gang leader, and his troubled sister find themselves trapped in a top secret government facility experimenting on children.

Title: 96. State Fair
description: A brother and sister find romance and good clean fun at the state fair in Dallas.

Title: 97. Satan Never Sleeps
description: During the Chinese Civil War of 1949, the Communists constantly harass the two priests of a remote Catholic mission outpost.

Title: 98. The Trial of Joan of Arc
description: A Joan of Arc's trial reconstruction concerning her imprisonment, interrogation and final execution at the hands of the English. Filmed in a spare, low-key fashion.

Title: 99. Sergeants 3
description: Three cavalry officers and a bugler work together to thwart a Native American chief intent on uniting local tribes against the white man.

Title: 100. Requiem for a Heavyweight
description: After suffering a brutal defeat and being told he can no longer fight, 37-year-old, scar-ridden prizefighter Louis 'Mountain' Rivera struggles to find a new direction in life.

Title: 101. Young Guns of Texas
description: A cowboy and 5 others pursue outlaws to recover stolen Union Army gold, while a revengeful rancher is it out to murder one of the pursuers.

Title: 102. Gay Purr-ee
description: A farm cat moves to Paris in search of the high life while her wannabe lover from back home tries to reunite.

Title: 103. The Premature Burial
description: An artist grows distant from his new wife as an irrational horror of premature burial consumes him.

Title: 104. Sherlock Holmes and the Deadly Necklace
description: Sherlock Holmes and Watson do battle with their nemesis, Professor Moriarity, over an ancient necklace attributed to Cleopatra.

Title: 105. The Three Stooges Meet Hercules
description: Three goofy druggists travel back to Ancient Greece on a milquetoast inventor's time machine.

Title: 106. Blaze Starr Goes Nudist
description: Stripper Blaze Starr, playing herself, drives her agent--who is also her fiancé--to distraction by ignoring scheduled "press functions" and spending her weekends at a nudist camp.

Title: 107. Curse of the Blood Ghouls
description: In 19th century Austria, a newlywed couple in an old castle soon are targeted by a savage vampire who is hellbent on destroying both their entire lives when he centers his main focus on the bride. Complications ensue for everyone involved.

Title: 108. Pressure Point
description: A Black prison psychiatrist is assigned the distasteful task of helping a paranoid American Nazi charged with sedition.

Title: 109. The Given Word
description: A simple yet devout Christian makes a vow to Saint Barbara after she saves his donkey, but everyone he meets seems determined to misunderstand his intentions. Will he be able to keep his promise in the end?

Title: 110. Two Weeks in Another Town
description: After spending three years in an asylum, a washed-up actor views a minor assignment from his old director in Rome as a chance for personal and professional redemption.

Title: 111. Damn the Defiant!
description: On the H.M.S. Defiant, during the French Revolutionary War, fair Captain Crawford is locked in a battle of wills against his cruel second-in-command Lieutenant Scott-Padget, whose heavy-handed command style pushes the crew to mutiny.

Title: 112. War of the Buttons
description: The school boys of two villages in France are fighting. Their trophy are the buttons they will snatch from the enemy. This fight will bring those kids to everlasting friendship...eventually.

Title: 113. Adam and 6 Eves
description: A man lost in the desert with his donkey comes across an oasis with six naked women.

Title: 114. The Cabinet of Caligari
description: A stranded young woman finds herself at a mysterious mansion where nothing is what it seems.

Title: 115. If a Man Answers
description: Rich socialite Chantal marries Eugene, a photographer, and everything seems blissful until her envious friend attempts to break them up. In desperation, she turns to her mother, but the advice she receives may do more harm than good.

Title: 116. All Fall Down
description: Ralph (Karl Malden) and Annabell Willart (Dame Angela Lansbury) are a feuding couple who are constantly bickering over their worthless, good-for-nothing son Berry-Berry (Warren Beatty). When Berry-Berry begins yet another meaningless love affair, this time with an older woman named Echo O'Brien (Eva Marie Saint), he really gets his parents at each others' throats.

Title: 117. Phaedra
description: To build bridges with his estranged son, a Greek shipping magnate enlists the help of his second wife, Phaedra. But, in rain-soaked Paris, their passionate affair threatens to destroy his empire. Will the modern temptress accept her fate?

Title: 118. The Spiral Road
description: In 1936, a Dutch physician who treats leprosy patients in the jungles of Indonesia has a dangerous run-in with a local witch-doctor who uses black magic to kill his enemies.

Title: 119. The Prince and the Pauper
description: Two boys, one a prince and one a poor boy, change places.

Title: 120. Light in the Piazza
description: Upper class Americans Noel and Meg Johnson have a twenty-six year old daughter named Clara Johnson. Clara suffered a head injury as a child which resulted in her being mentally disabled. Clara's mental capacity is equivalent to that of a ten year old. In many social situations, Clara's disability can be passed off as a simple joy of life. The issue of Clara's care has placed a strain between Noel and Meg, the latter who clings to the hope that one day Clara can lead a "normal" life. While on an extended vacation through Italy, Meg and Clara meet a twenty-three year old Italian named Fabrizio Naccarelli in Florence. Fabrizio is instantly smitten with Clara, who returns the affection. Always protecting Clara, Meg initially resists Fabrizio's constant measures to insinuate himself into their lives. But as Meg learns more about Fabrizio and meets his family, Meg begins to believe a marriage between Fabrizio and Clara is Clara's chance for that normal life, all the while not telling the Naccarellis of Clara's issue. This belief places a further strain between Meg and Noel, who still wants Clara placed in some sort of institution. Not having met the Naccarellis, Noel also believes they have ulterior motives in their actions. But what happens if the Nacarellis find out about Clara's disability?

Title: 121. Tender Is the Night
description: A Psychiatrist and his life with a patient he helped to recover.

Title: 122. Crazy Desire
description: A middle-aged and slightly conservative businessman meets a band of rowdy youths and is smitten by one named Francesca. He is pursuaded to join their party and even pay for most of it, as he finds himself strangely attracted to Francesca, who seems his complete opposite.

Title: 123. Gigot
description: Jackie Gleason plays a mute janitor who befriends Nicole, the little daughter of a prostitute.

Title: 124. The Three Stooges in Orbit
description: The Stooges must battle alien spies to safeguard a goofy scientist's revolutionary new vehicle.

Title: 125. The Slave
description: During the power struggle between Caesar and Crassus, a Roman centurion, who is the lost son of Spartacus, is dispatched to Crassus' camp to observe his movements and keep Caesar informed.

Title: 126. Weekend
description: A group of wealthy middle-aged people meet at a summerhouse. They spend the time nagging and quarreling out of frustration.

Title: 127. Salvatore Giuliano
description: The unclear and complicated twists between governal powers, independentist party and Mafia in the Sicily of the '40s culminate with the death of Salvatore Giuliano.

Title: 128. Parthal Pasi Theerum
description: Believing his wife to be dead, a soldier with the British-Indian army marries another woman and moves on. But what happens when he discovers that his wife is actually alive?

Title: 129. Pitfall
description: A man wanders into a seemingly deserted town with his young son in search of work. But after a bit of bad luck, he joins the town's population of lost souls.

Title: 130. A Monkey in Winter
description: Albert is an inn owner who vowed never to drink again if he and his wife survived the war. They did, and the reformed alcoholic keeps his vow. But times have changed and soon after the war, Albert comes in contact with Gabriel, a young man prone to heavy bouts with the bottle. Gabriel is conflicted over visiting his young daughter in a nearby school and in a moment of nostalgia, Albert takes off with him on one major binge -- and havoc results.

Title: 131. The L-Shaped Room
description: A single, pregnant woman moves into a London boarding house where she meets a group of fellow misfits.

Title: 132. The Girls
description: Several romance stories - part funny, part sadly - set in a remote logging camp.

Title: 133. Eva
description: A raw Welsh novelist in Venice is humiliated by a money-loving Frenchwoman who erotically ensnares him.

Title: 134. Five Miles to Midnight
description: Lisa's husband Robert fakes his death in a plane crash to collect insurance. She's trapped between helping him commit fraud and her growing feelings for David Barnes, until she makes one final, desperate choice.

Title: 135. 13 West Street
description: An aerospace engineer (Ladd) ignores a policeman (Steiger) and hunts down a gang of juvenile delinquents.

Title: 136. 40 Pounds of Trouble
description: Hilarity ensues when a casino manager spends a day at Disneyland with a cute but troublesome little girl.

Title: 137. The Bellboy and the Playgirls
description: This Bellboy is after more than just big tips.

Title: 138. Journey to the Seventh Planet
description: Earth sends a five-man team to explore the frozen planet Uranus, only to find a temperate forest and sultry women from their past on it, courtesy of an alien brain with evil designs.

Title: 139. The Day Mars Invaded Earth
description: Martians replace a scientist and his family to pave the way for their invasion of Earth.

Title: 140. Merrill's Marauders
description: During WW2, a 3000-strong American unit, known as Merrill's Marauders, battles the Japanese forces in Burma.

Title: 141. Rome Adventure
description: Under fire for giving a student her copy of a romance novel, Prudence resigns from her teaching position and sails for Italy.

Title: 142. Santo vs. the Vampire Women
description: A professor recruits a professional wrestler to protect his daughter from vampires intent on kidnaping her and marrying her to the devil.

Title: 143. The Inheritance
description: A dying businessman intends to will two hundred million yen to his three illegitimate children, but his associates scheme to take advantage of the situation.

Title: 144. The Witch's Mirror
description: A husband murders his wife, and years later her ghost emerges from a witch's mirror to take her revenge.

Title: 145. Billy Rose's Jumbo
description: A debt-ridden circus is saved by a well-meaning but inept publicity man.

Title: 146. Adieu Philippine
description: Paris, summer 1960. Michel is about to leave for Algeria for military service. He meets Liliane and Juliette, two inseparable friends. Michel goes on vacation to Corsica, where the two girls decide to join him

Title: 147. The Terror of Doctor Mabuse
description: German Police Inspector Lohmann investigates a string of crimes resembling Dr. Mabuse's M.O. but Mabuse is in Professor Polland's care inside an insane asylum.

Title: 148. The Silent Invasion
description: During WWII, a German garrison is stationed in the small French town of Mereux. French local Maria falls in love with a German captain. However, the romance comes to an abrupt end when her brother, a saboteur working for the Resistance, is killed.

Title: 149. The Awful Dr. Orlof
description: Dr. Orlof, a former prison doctor, abducts beautiful women from nightclubs and tries to use their skin to repair his daughter's fire-scarred face.

Title: 151. Boys' Night Out
description: Four men bored with their Thursday nights out from their wives (and mom) rent a love nest in New York City, equipped with a blonde. What they don't know is that she's writing a postgraduate thesis on sexual fantasies of urban men.

Title: 152. Agostino
description: Agostino is a 13-year-old boy on vacation in Venice with his widowed mother. When a local stud seduces her, jealous Agostino joins a local group of juvenile delinquents out of protest. They force him to face his budding sexuality.

Title: 153. My Geisha
description: An actress disguises herself as a geisha in order to land the lead role in her director husband's film version of 'Madam Butterfly'.

Title: 154. Sundays and Cybèle
description: Story of a lonely young girl who is befriended by an innocent but emotionally disabled veteran of the French Indochina War.

Title: 155. Love at Twenty
description: "Love at Twenty" unites five directors from around the world to present their different perspectives on what love really is at the age of 20. The episodes are united with the score of Georges Delerue and still photos of Henri Cartier-Bresson. The directors create their peculiar scenarios with Truffaut revisiting Antoine Doinel, this time finding some meaning to his life while getting involved with a girl; Renzo Rossellini's episode about an abandoned mistress; Ishihara's tale about an obsessive love; Ophüls' story about a pregnant woman trying to plot against the baby's father; and Wajda presenting a confusing relationship between people from different generations.

Title: 156. The Reluctant Saint
description: In 17th century Italy, a simple and clumsy young man joins a Franciscan order, pursues full priesthood and performs a miracle that eventually ensures his sainthood.

Title: 157. Term of Trial
description: A British high-school girl becomes infatuated with her English teacher, but after he rejects her amorous advances, she goes to the police and accuses him of indecent assault.

Title: 158. Who's Got the Action?
description: Horse-player Steve Flood's marriage is threatened by his betting; in desperation, his wife Melanie becomes his bookie and enlists his lecherous law partner Clint Morgan to help. Steve's hot streak causes unforeseen complications.

Title: 159. House of Women
description: Drama about a young woman, Erica, who is wrongly implicated in a crime and sent to prison for five years, where she faces deplorable conditions. With the aid of the warden, she sets out to prove her innocence.

Title: 160. A View from the Bridge
description: Eddie harbors secret love for his niece Catherine. When her cousins, illegal immigrants Marco and Rodolpho, arrive, Catherine falls for Rodolpho. Eddie, consumed by jealousy, reports the immigrants, leading to tragic consequences.

Title: 161. The World's Greatest Sinner
description: A restless insurance agent leaves work to enter politics, promoting human immortality and potential. He creates "The Eternal Man" party and gains the nickname "God," but later questions his beliefs.

Title: 162. Almost Angels
description: Supported avidly by his mother and more reluctantly at first by his father, a working-class Austrian boy joins the Vienna Choirboys, where he proves to be unusually talented. The standard initiation ordeals which new boys must endure at the hands of their seniors are intensified in his case because he has aroused the jealousy of Peter, the head chorister, by singing a solo which Peter had long sung himself. The fact is that Peter's voice is breaking, and with a broken voice often comes a broken heart. But, encouraged by the director and all the boys, Peter begins to develop in a new role as composer and conductor.

Title: 163. Bon Voyage!
description: A family takes a long delayed trip to Europe and finds an unending series of comedy adventures.

Title: 164. The Treasure of the Silver Lake
description: In their first cinematic adventure, Apache chief Winnetou and mountain man Old Shatterhand pursue a gang of murderous outlaws who will stop at nothing to find the legendary treasure of Silver Lake.

Title: 165. Chushingura
description: After their lord is tricked into committing ritual suicide, forty-seven samurai warriors await the chance to avenge their master and reclaim their honor.

Title: 166. Young and Willing
description: University students form relationships and perform pranks with disastrous consequences all round.

Title: 167. Diamond Head
description: In 1950's Hawaii, a bigoted and ruthless land baron, with political ambitions, bans his sister from marrying a native Hawaiian even though he himself has secretly impregnated an Asian woman.

Title: 168. Hemingway's Adventures of a Young Man
description: An immature young man from Middle America grows to manhood after a cross-country journey and his military service in World War I.

Title: 169. A Very Private Affair
description: When Jill becomes a movie star she soon discovers that her private life is destroyed by persistent fans that won't leave her alone. Her mother's ex-lover, Fabio, tries to protect her.

Title: 170. War Hunt
description: Dispatched to the front lines during the Korean War, an idealistic American soldier discovers the horrors of combat and comes at odds with a psychopathic member of his platoon.

Title: 171. The Boys
description: In 1962 London, four troublesome teenagers are charged by the police with robbing a garage and murdering the night watchman.

Title: 172. Big Red
description: A wealthy sportsman's decision to hire a backwoods orphan to exercise a champion Irish Setter has unexpected consequences.

Title: 173. Marco Polo
description: Italian explorer rescues the daughter of the Mongol leader Kublai Khan, meets a hermit who has invented gunpowder and builds a cannon.

Title: 174. Period of Adjustment
description: A newlywed couple's honeymoon is disrupted by their friends' marital problems.

Title: 175. Fury of Achilles
description: In the tenth year of the Trojan War, tensions between Achilles and Agamemnon divide the Greek camp while giving hope to the Trojans.

Title: 176. The Brainiac
description: In 1661 Mexico, Baron Vitelius is executed for witchcraft. 300 years later, during a comet's return, he resurfaces as a brain-eating monster seeking revenge on the Inquisitors' descendants.

Title: 177. The Lion
description: In Kenya, when young Tina befriends a lion and embraces local customs, her mother summons Tina's American father to help bring Tina back to civilization and give her a civilized upbringing.

Title: 178. The Man from the First Century
description: A workman is accidentally sent into outer space, where he meets an alien that can make himself invisible. They return to Earth in the year 2447. Complications ensue.

Title: 179. El filibusterismo
description: Juan Crisostomo Ibarra has changed his name and identity to rich jeweler Simoun. In disguise, he travels the world amassing wealth, which he intends to use to topple the corrupt and abusive regime in his native land. But Simoun's real motive is personal. He wants to rescue his beloved, Maria Clara, from the convent and avenge the death of his father. In a forest on Christmas Eve, medical student Basilio recognizes Simoun as the man who helped bury his mother Sisa under a tree over 10 years ago. Simoun is in the forest to retrieve the gems he buried near Sisa's grave. As the film progresses, all the secrets and intrigues are revealed, and the plotters' plan fails. A good Filipino priest throws Simoun's jewels away, thereby eliminating the greed, violence, and other evils they might have provoked.

Title: 180. Arabian Nights: The Adventures of Sinbad
description: A young sailor named Sinbad and his sidekick Ali find a map to a fabulous treasure and stow away aboard a ship in an effort to get to where the treasure is buried. They eventually convince the ship's captain to change course and help them find the treasure. Along the way they come up against a wicked Vizier, a giant bird, vicious whirlpools and other obstacles.

Title: 181. The Fast Lady
description: A naive Scotsman buys a vintage sports car and learns to drive in order to impress the daughter of an arrogant aristocrat who despises him.

Title: 182. No Exit
description: A valet guides a man into a windowless, mirrorless hotel room with a single entrance. Two women join them, then the valet locks them inside. Trapped, the trio realizes they're in hell, anticipating a grim fate.

Title: 183. Love on a Pillow
description: A young girl rescues a man from a suicide attempt. He turns out to be a sociopath, who begins to take over her life, abusing her both verbally and emotionally, yet she can't seem to tear herself away from him.

Title: 184. Death Trap
description: A young woman commits suicide. Her sister is not ready to let the death go without someone answering a few questions. was it really suicide, and where is the large amount of money her sister withdrew from the bank the day before her death?

Title: 185. China Town
description: A Darjeeling-based singer is asked to impersonate and take over the life of a Calcutta-based China Town gangster.

Title: 186. Cartouche
description: The story of a kid from the back streets who wants to become king of Paris. Brought up among petty thieves, he becomes their leader through an audacious and elegant coup which wins him the love of the beautiful Venus.

Title: 187. Jessica
description: Jealous of a beautiful widowed midwife, her female neighbors in their small Sicilian village plot her ruin by refusing to have anything to do with their husbands.

Title: 188. Moon Pilot
description: Away on a short leave before an upcoming moon launch, a NASA astronaut disappears and is feared kidnapped when the security services learn about his friendship with a suspected foreign female spy.

Title: 189. The Four Days of Naples
description: The film shows the history of the Neapolitan popular revolt against the invading Germans during World War II. During the four days in Naples, the revolt turns over in just a few hours. Neapolitans slung on rifles and guns or armed themselves with stones, house-objects, gasoline-bottles, anything and everything, anonymous and silent. Gennarino Capuozzo, a 10-year-old killed on a barricade while he was fighting against the invaders, is remembered as a hero.

Title: 190. Electra
description: Living in exile after their father's death, the children of an usurped and murdered king converge to exact eye-for-an-eye revenge.

Title: 191. Shades of Zorro
description: Two brothers, Billy and Dan, head to California, determined to hunt down and kill Zorro to avenge the death of their brother.

Title: 192. Six Black Horses
description: A beautiful woman with an ulterior motive hires two gunslingers to escort her through Indian territory so she can be reunited with her awaiting husband.

Title: 193. It's Only Money
description: A TV repairman dreams of being a detective and sets out to locate a missing heir.

Title: 194. Five Finger Exercise
description: A long-married couple are at war with each other and with their teenage son and daughter. The presence of a handsome young tutor complicates and sensitizes the savage domestic tensions which arise as the secret emotions of members of the family are shockingly revealed.

Title: 195. Escape from East Berlin
description: In 1962, a group of East Berliners escapes to West Berlin through a tunnel dug from the basement of a house located near the Berlin Wall.

Title: 196. The Grim Reaper
description: When a woman is killed in a park, the police bring in everyone suspected of being there when the incident occurred and question them. One of them is the killer.

Title: 197. Alone Against Rome
description: A Roman Consul, on his way to fight a border war, stations a garrison of soldiers in a provincial town. The townspeople aren't happy with this situation but decide it's in their best interests to cooperate. However, the Tribune left in charge of the garrison proves to be cruel and demanding. He takes over a house for his own use and forces his attentions on Fabiola, the owner's daughter. She reluctantly submits in order to protect the life of her lover, Brenno, who's already been publicly whipped and who's been hauled off to the local arena to provide sport for Roman gladiators. Soon, Brenno and Fabiola's brother are organizing a resistance which will put an end to the Tribune's reign of tyranny.

Title: 198. Hitler
description: Biopic of Adolf Hitler focusing on his relationships with various women from 1923 to 1945.

Title: 199. The Swingin' Maiden
description: During a steam engine race, an American airline firm plans to buy a new British passenger plane, but the deal hits trouble when the designer and the daughter of the Airline owner take an instant dislike to each other after a crash.

Title: 200. Wild Guitar
description: Aspiring singer Bud meets dancer Vickie. He signs with shady manager McCauley. Bud achieves success but faces manipulation. Kidnapped, he reconciles with Vickie, confronts McCauley with evidence, forcing honest management.

Title: 201. The Pirates of Blood River
description: A group of ruthless pirates attack a seventeenth century Huguenot settlement on the Isle of Devon in search of treasure and will stop at nothing to obtain it.

Title: 202. Walk in the Shadow
description: When John Harris's daughter is badly injured in an boating accident, the hospital tells him that she will need an urgent blood transfusion. Due to his religious beliefs Harris refuses permission, and the child dies. When the inquest clears Harris of all blame, the doctor in charge of the case tries to get the police to press manslaughter charges against Harris.

Title: 203. Satan in High Heels
description: A carnival burlesque dancer robs her junkie ex-husband, goes to New York, gets a job at a high-class club where she becomes the mistress of the wealthy owner. She seduces his son and causes a murder.

Title: 204. The Road to Hong Kong
description: Mistaken identity and the acquisition of a rare Tibetan herb put two buffoonish con men on the wrong side of a secret organization geared toward world domination.

Title: 205. Sahib Bibi Aur Ghulam
description: A lowly servant, Bhootnath gets close to the wife of his employer and narrates her story through his eyes and perspective.

Title: 206. Therese
description: Unhappy in her marriage to a boring man who doesn't love her, a woman plans to get rid of him by slowly increasing the dosage of his medication.

Title: 207. The Witch's Curse
description: Maciste travels to Hell to find a witch and make her undo a curse she put on the surface world.

Title: 208. Planeta bur
description: Cosmonauts land on the planet Venus. However, they find themselves in danger from the voracious monsters they find on it.

Title: 209. Operation Snatch
description: Legend has it that if the famous Barbary Apes leave the Rock of Gibraltar, it's a sign that the British will lose control of it. During World War II, a British officer is put in charge of the apes. When he detects that the animals' morale is slipping, he hatches a plan to go behind the German lines to "kidnap" a new ape for his charges to lift their spirits before the Germans find out about their condition and use it as propaganda.

Title: 210. Escape from Zahrain
description: A hunted revolutionary leads a rag tag group of individuals through the desert in an attempt to elude the security forces and escape the fictitious Arab country of Zahrain.

Title: 211. Kozara
description: The struggle of the Yugoslav partisans against the Germans.

Title: 212. Women of Devil's Island
description: Female prisoners are shipped to Devil's Island penal colony. They are indoctrinated into the prison life from abusive guards and then a new prison governor arrives with planned reforms.

Title: 213. Planets Around Us
description: An alien race sends cyborgs--made to look like the son of a famous scientist, whom they killed when he landed on their planet--to Earth to help pave the way for an invasion.

Title: 214. Ninja, a Band of Assassins
description: A young ninja becomes embroiled in a plot to kill a tyrannical warlord. He journeys across feudal Japan, facing deceit, betrayal, and enemy ninja at every turn. Goemon must complete his mission, regain his honor, and survive.

Title: 215. My Son, the Hero
description: An evil king makes a bargain with a devil in order to get away with murdering his wife.

Title: 216. Lafayette
description: During the American War of Independence, French officer and nobleman La Fayette comes to America's aid with men, money and weapons and becomes a Major-General under George Washington's command.

Title: 217. The Avenger
description: Aeneas leads escapees from the Trojan war to new land in Italy, and must deal with new threats to his people.

Title: 218. The Devil and the Ten Commandments
description: 1) Jerôme Chambard, a retired man, taken in by nuns in a convent, swears like a trooper. 2) Françoise takes a lover because he has promised her a diamond necklace. 3) Denis, a seminarist, decides to renounce his vows to avenge his sister. 4) God in person lands at a remote farm and works miracles there. 5) Pierre learns that his mother is not his mother, but a famous actress. 6) Didier, a bank clerk, teams up with a bank thief after being fired by the manager 7) Jerôme Chambard is invited to Sunday lunch by his friend the bishop and by dint of drinking to their friendship the holy man cannot remember the ten commandments anymore

Title: 219. Nudes of All Nations
description: Old-fashioned nudist romp.

Title: 220. Invasion of the Star Creatures
description: Two Abbott and Costello-type soldiers find plantlike creatures that are under the control of two beautiful alien scientists who are bent on conquering Earth.

Title: 221. It Happened in Athens
description: In 1896 it is announced that the Olympic Games will be revived in Athens. A young shepherd, Spiridon Loues, decides to enter the 26-mile marathon. Once in Athens, he meets Christina Gratsos, a young woman from his hometown who is now the personal maid of Eleni Costa, Greece's most glamorous actress. Though he has arrived after the qualification date, Spiridon's athletic prowess so impresses Coach Graham of the American team that he is permitted to enter the contest. Eleni informs the press that she will marry the victor, confident it will be her lover, Lieutenant Vinardos.

Title: 222. Family Diary
description: A man recalls the life of his late younger brother.

Title: 224. Bees Saal Baad
description: When a young man's family gets haunted by a spirit, he is warned not to return to his hometown, but he decides to investigate the issue.

Title: 225. Hero's Island
description: In 1718, on a small island off the Carolina coast, a recently freed family of indentured servants plans to settle and homestead there but they run into conflict with a group of fishermen also claiming ownership of the island.

Title: 226. The Inn on the River
description: Inspector Wade hunts down The Shark, a criminal equipped with a wetsuit and a speargun.

Title: 227. Lisa
description: At the end of WW2, a compassionate Dutch policeman helps smuggle a Jewish woman into British Palestine.

Title: 228. Gorath
description: A Tokyo scientist and his colleagues shift Earth to avoid a red-hot planet on a collision course.

Title: 229. The Devil's Trap
description: A priest travels to investigate a miller suspected to be working with the devil.

Title: 230. The Tale of Zatoichi Continues
description: The blind masseur and swordsman, Zatoichi, learns of a powerful political figure's secret and is quickly tailed by a group of killers.

Title: 231. The Third Lover
description: André Mercier, a journalist known as Albin Mercier, is a failed, embittered writer. Sent to cover an event in Germany, he gets to know Andreas Hartmann, another writer who, for his part, has not... failed. The successful Andreas is married to Hélène, a beautiful Frenchwoman. Both attracted to her and jealous of the couple's happiness, Mercier decides to shatter it. Taking advantage of the absence of Andreas, off on a business trip, he tries to seduce Hélène and to become her lover. But things do not go according to plan...

Title: 232. Seven Seas to Calais
description: Sir Francis Drake goes on an expedition to the New World and steals the gold from the Spanish.

Title: 233. Asli-Naqli
description: Renu lives a poor lifestyle with her mom, dad and a brother. Her dad decides to travel to Africa so that he can earn enough money to send his son to study engineering, so that he can find employment abroad. But fate has other plans when one day Renu's brother returns home sick from college, and shortly thereafter passes away. His shocked father books a seat on a plane to attend his son's funeral, but the plane crashes killing everyone on board. Shattered and devastated, Renu decides to hide her dad's death from her ill and fragile mom, and goes along pretending that her father is still alive. She obtains employment and through her earnings convinces her mom that her dad is regularly sending money. Then things brighten up when a homeless young man, Anand, enters her life, both fall in love with each other and want to get married. But once again fate plays a cruel joke on Renu as she subsequently finds out that Anand is not who he claims to be, but is in fact, a playboy, the grandson, nicknamed 'Prince", of one of the wealthiest man in town, Dwarkadas, and Anand is scheduled to get married to Rekha - the only heir to a multi-million rupee estate. Watch as events unfold and the effect this news has on the townspeople and Renu's mom.

Title: 234. The Legend of Lobo
description: When both parents are killed by man, the wolf Lobo learns the ways of the hunter.

Title: 235. No Man Is an Island
description: During the early Pacific war years, American seaman George Tweed is the only U.S. serviceman on Guam not captured by the Japanese forces.

Title: 236. Maciste contro i mostri
description: Wandering strongman Maxxus comes upon two warring tribes, the Sun worshipers and the Moon worshipers. He saves the leader of the Sun tribe from a sea monster, then later on when the Moon tribe attacks and kidnaps the Sun tribe's women, they call upon Maxxus for help.

Title: 237. Venus fra Vestø
description: Vestø island's isolated community's prize cow is in danger of being abducted by German WWII occupation forces.

Title: 238. Only Two Can Play
description: A frustrated librarian (Sellers) in Swansea, Wales is torn between his wife Jean (Maskell) and a glamorous married woman, Liz (Zetterling), who wants to have an affair.

Title: 239. Hand of Death
description: Alex Marsh has created a serum combining a hypnotic drug and nerve gas. Unfortunately spills the formula, breathing the vapors and getting some on his hands causing the drug transforms him into a murderous monster.

Title: 240. Destiny's Son
description: A samurai seeks revenge and redemption after his family is executed by a rival clan.

Title: 241. The Swedish Mistress
description: If someone just then had told her that she in a few months would be the mistress of her boss, she would have become aggrieved and indignant. Women who tangled with married men were not acceptable to her.

Title: 242. The Graceful Brute
description: A greedy, materialistic family attempts to cover-up the embezzlement committed by the son while keeping their other schemes active. They discover there are other, equally conniving players involved.

Title: 243. Mermaids of Tiburon
description: A diver is aided in his search for sunken treasure by beautiful mermaids.

Title: 244. Zotz!
description: A professor comes into possession of an amulet with magical powers.

Title: 245. Married Too Young
description: Two high-school sweethearts get married, then find that married life isn't what they thought it would be. In their desperation, they get mixed up with a gang of car thieves.

Title: 246. The Broken Land
description: A loner cowboy gets entangled in a town's fight against a corrupt sheriff. His involvement with a local woman leads to violence, robbery, and murder, leaving the cowboy a wanted man pursued by a posse.

Title: 247. Forever My Love
description: The romantic "Sissi" trilogy condensed into one film. Emperor Franz Joseph of Austria falls in love with young princess Elisabeth.

Title: 248. Stark Fear
description: A sadistic husband mentally tortures his wife, while eventually planning to murder her. Although no one believes her, she gets help from an unexpected source.

Title: 249. Two Tickets to Paris
description: In this musical, fairly light movie, two young people, Joey and Piper are in love. They embark on a cruise to Paris to get married, with the acerbic but kind Aggie as a chaperone. Along the way, their sweet innocent romance runs into trouble when Coco, a French dancer uses Joey to make her straying boyfriend jealous.

Title: 250. Les mystères de Paris
description: The Marquis Rodolphe de Sombreuil accidentally runs over a working man with his carriage and helps his widow -- unjustly accused of robbery -- to find her missing daughter.

Title: 251. La mano de un hombre muerto
description: When violent crime strikes a tiny hamlet, the townsfolk suspect the distant relative of a sadistic 17th century baron who cursed the village.

Title: 253. Smog
description: An ambitious Italian attorney has his flight delayed in Los Angeles. The vapid lawyer goes to some parties with some Italians living there and has a brief affair with a beautiful Italian expatriate.

Title: 254. A Girl Named Tamiko
description: A Eurasian photographer uses his women in an attempt to get American nationality.

Title: 255. Prem Patra
description: While studying in medical college Arun Kumar Mathur (Shashi Kapoor) has a misunderstanding over a love letter with Kavita Kapoor (Sadhana), and must leave the college, much to his dismay. Kavita later finds out that it was not Arun's fault, but Arun has already left town. Arun's marriage is arranged with Saroj Chowdhary (Seema Deo), who also happens to be a distant relative of Kavita. When Arun loses his vision in an accident, Saroj is unable to go to take care of him, and Kavita takes her place. Unwilling to reveal her identity, Kavita let's him think it is Saroj, not her. She learns that he still hates and despises her. Soon it will be time to take bandages off his eyes, and he will be able to see again, much to the dread of Kavita.

Title: 256. Tarzan Goes to India
description: Summoned to India by a dying maharajah, Tarzan attempts to remove an elephant herd from a valley to be flooded upon completion of a modern dam.

Title: 257. Varan the Unbelievable
description: Heavily alerted American version of Japan's Varan. A prehistoric behemoth is unwittingly awoken from hibernation due to a U.S-Japanese military experiment for economic means on it's watery lair.

Title: 258. Gundamma Katha
description: Gundamma has two children and a stepdaughter whom she mistreats; she hopes to get a 'resident' son-in-law who will look after the family; two brothers decide to teach the old woman a lesson.

Title: 259. The Door with Seven Locks
description: A woman arrives at a lonely mansion and finds herself mixed up with a lunatic who has built his own torture chamber, which is already crowded with victims - and he plans to make her his next one.

Title: 260. We Joined the Navy
description: This is the story of the riotous, romantic, exciting, astonishing and highly entertaining adventures of Lieutenant Commander "Bodger" Badger, R.N. (Kenneth More). An exceptionally likeable fellow, the Badger has one besetting sin, a shining honesty.

Title: 261. Zorro in the Court of Spain
description: The perfidious brother of the deceased Duke of Lusitania usurps the throne from its legitimate heir, the Grand Duchess; however, an enigmatic man in black known only as the Zorro is out for justice. But, who is this valiant vindicator?

Title: 262. The Seventh Juror
description: In a moment of madness a respectable pharmacist kills a young woman who is sun-bathing by a lake. Unable to take in what he has done, he flees from the scene of the crime and behaves as if nothing has happened.

Title: 263. Careless
description: The place is Trieste and the time is 1927. Emilio Brentani leads a peaceful and uneventful life with his older sister Amalia. At least until the day he meets Angiolina Zarri, a beautiful young woman. But the lady is also fickle, wayward and coquettish. Unfortunately for him, Emilio falls madly in love with her...

Title: 264. The Seven Deadly Sins
description: The vision of the seven deadly sins by seven French directors as follows: (1) Anger: In a gentle French town, several men find flies in their Sunday soups. They have arguments with their wives, that grows successively to the streets, country and world. (2) Gluttony: A family arrives late for the buffet of the funeral of the father of the patriarch. (3) Envy: The maid Rosette is envious of a movie star that is lodged in the hotel she works. Rosette seduces her lover and later she returns to the hotel as a client. 4) Lust: Two friends discuss the meaning of lust. One of them recalls that when he was a child, he misunderstood the meaning of lust with luxury. (5) Sloth: An aspirant actress asks for a ride to the actor Eddie Constantine with the clear intention to seduce him. They go to his apartment, but Eddie is so lazy that does not have sex with her to avoid having to dress again. (6) Pride: One unfaithful couple cheats each other. The businesswoman has a love affair with a man that asks her to travel to Paris with him and get married when she gets the divorce. Her husband is a salesman that cheats her with her friend Heloise. (7) Greed: Seven university students want to have sex with an expensive prostitute that charges 50,000 francs to spend a night with the client. They decide to make a lottery with 25 students giving 2,000 francs each. On the next morning, the prostitute asks the winner how he got money to be with her, and he tells about the lottery. She says that she will return his money but greed wins.

Title: 265. The Brain
description: After the mysterious crash of a millionaire's private airplane, three scientists secretly harvest the dying man's brain and keep it alive in a laboratory in order to communicate with it through telepathy.

Title: 266. Sign of the Lion
description: A French-American in Paris lives by sponging off his working friends, and throws a party using borrowed money when his rich American aunt dies, believing firmly in his horoscope.

Title: 267. The Invisible Dr. Mabuse
description: Evil mastermind Dr. Mabuse seeks Professor Erasmus' secret invention, a device that makes one invisible, but a murder in a revue theatre brings the German police and the FBI into the mix.

Title: 268. Three Fables of Love
description: "Les quatre vérités" aka "The Four Truths" is a movie anthology that consists of four segments, all loosely parodying fables from the 17th-century French poet Jean de la Fontaine. The US cut usually features only 3 segments.

Title: 269. Confessions of an Opium Eater
description: In 19th-century San Francisco's Chinatown, American adventurer Gilbert De Quincey saves slave girls owned by the Chinese Tong factions.

Title: 270. Twice Round the Daffodils
description: A group of patients resides in a sanatorium and aspire to walk twice round the daffodils, which they can do when they are better.

Title: 271. Hands of a Stranger
description: A concert pianist loses his hands in a car crash, but a surgeon gives him new ones. The experimental medical procedure goes awry when the new hands drive the pianist mad.

Title: 272. The Password Is Courage
description: British N.C.O. Sergeant Major Charles Coward (Sir Dirk Bogarde) escapes from the Stalag VIII-B P.O.W. camp, and is mistakenly awarded with the Iron Cross by the Germans.

Title: 273. Arturo's Island
description: First love experience of a teenage boy living on an isolated island.

Title: 274. Don't Knock the Twist
description: Many twist-dancers meet to prepare for the TV variety show "The Twist." While the special is still in the production stages, jealousies lead to problems--and a whole lot of dancing.

Title: 275. The Condemned of Altona
description: An insane German war criminal lives in a secluded house owned by his rich father who lets him think the war is still on, some 15 years after the fact.

Title: 276. The Son of Captain Blood
description: The son of a notorious pirate is placed on the path of righteousness by his love for a beautiful young woman.

Title: 277. Some People
description: The story of three teenaged tearaways Johnnie, Bill and Bert who find themselves at odds with society. Following a brush with the law they have a chance meeting with a local choirmaster who offers them a way of making good.

Title: 278. Copacabana Palace
description: Luiz Bonfá, João Gilberto and Antonio Carlos Jobim appear as themselves in this Italian light comedy set in Brasil.

Title: 279. Charge of the Black Lancers
description: Sergio of Tula goes to Dubno to free Princess Mascia, who is prisoner of Queen Jassa, but he is seduced by the latter, who stirs his ambition by putting her army at his service to take King Stephen's throne.

Title: 280. Nine Days of One Year
description: Nuclear physicists are risking their lives for scientific achievements.

Title: 281. Saintly Sinners
description: A kindly old priest reforms a collection of lovable fellows in his humble parish.

Title: 282. Damon and Pythias
description: Pythias, a liberal Athenian who believes all men are brothers, is condemned to death by Dionysus, the tyrant of Syracuse, who finds this view dangerous. However, Dionysus allows Pythias to return to Athens to visit his ailing wife with the understanding he will then come back to face his punishment. Damon, a friend of Pythias, volunteers to be a hostage to guarantee Pythias's return. Dionysius doesn't expect Pythias to keep his end of the bargain, thus exposing the falsity of his beliefs.

Title: 283. Vulcan, Son of Jupiter
description: A superhero battles lizard men and other monsters that are terrorizing the countryside.

Title: 284. Love, Thy Name Be Sorrow
description: In the reign of the Emperor Suzaku (930- 946 A.D.), various mishaps happen after a strange white rainbow in appearance in the sky over Kyoto. The Emperor orders a famous astronomer, Yasunori, to consult a certain Chinese book of secrets to calm the fear of the people. Yasunori has two disciples, Yasuna and Doman. But he desires that Yasuna succeeds him because Doman is interested only in power. Assisted by Yasunori's wife, Doman sends his follower, Akuemon, to kill Yasunori. Doman also steals the secret book and puts the blame on Yasuna and his sweetheart, Sakaki, Yasunori's adopted daughter. Sakaki commits suicide and Yasuna kills Yasunori's wife in his rage. He retrieves the secret book and sets out on a journey without destination. He meets her younger sister, Kuzunoha, with whom he falls in love at Sakaki's home town. Lord Iwakura, Yasunori's brother-in-low, advices the Court that the Crown Prince has no child and this causes tourmoils. Akuemon is summoned to catch a white female fox which is to be used for charming away the curse on the Prince. Akuemon fails to find a white female fox, but meets Yasuna who has protected the foxes. Akuemon beats Yasuna and takes Kuzunoha with him. But Yasuna is rescued by a white fox. The white fox asks his daughter to transform herself in the shape of Kuzunoha to live together with him. After that, they have a baby. When Kuzunoha escapes from Akuemon and comes to Yasuna, the female fox in the shape of Kuzunoha disappears leaving a poem (tanka) beside her sleeping baby.

Title: 285. The Underwater City
description: An engineer, a psychologist and several other disparate types take part in an experiment to see if people can live for extended periods of time in a city built under the ocean.

Title: 286. Professor
description: A college grad in need of money must disguise himself as an old man to tutor two young women who are under the watchful eye of their strict aunt.

Title: 287. The Husband of My Wife
description: A philandering pharmacist has a chance encounter with an alluring blonde stranger who insists that she is his wife. Now, a revered psychiatrist attempts to shed light on a curious case of split personality. Who's the husband of his wife?

Title: 288. The Quare Fellow
description: In Ireland, a newly hired prison guard has to deal with the realities of prison work and to face the grim issue of death-row executions.

Title: 289. Nature's Playmates
description: Chicago private detective Russell Harper and his assistant, Diana, travel to a Florida nudist camp to find a missing husband and both of them soon become embroided with the life of nudists while falling in love with each other.

Title: 290. Airborne
description: The story of a young man and his journey to become a US paratrooper.

Title: 291. Den kære familie
description: Days before year 1900, a successful businessman and widower has his son, 3 daughters and +1s over for dinner. Managing their lives regarding spouses is a lot more complicated than managing business deals.

Title: 292. Black Test Car
description: Two car manufacturers spy on each other to try to find out details and prices of a new sports car each is about to launch.

Title: 293. Mr. Peters' Pets
description: A man orders some "animal ambrosia" so he can turn into animals and be able to watch naked women.

Title: 294. Surftide 77
description: Private Eye Bernard Bingbang is hired by old lady Agatha Bungworthy to find her runaway niece Cynthia, heir to the family fortune.

Title: 295. A Pair of Briefs
description: She's new in chambers, and he's a troublemaker. But what *is* the true status of the old lady's wartime marriage, and can the two young legal minds find the answer?

Title: 296. Tiara Tahiti
description: James Mason and Sir John Mills star in this comedy-drama about a tough Colonel and a refined Captain who clashed during the war and continue their personal battle in peacetime Tahiti.

Title: 297. Maa Beta
description: Dependent on his elder brother, Bishan, Ganga and his wife, Rameshwari, are abused and asked to leave. They work hard, set up their own business, and soon become wealthy enough to even support Bishan and his wife. A pregnant Rameshwari gets the news that her husband has been killed. She subsequently gives birth to a boy, who goes missing. Will Rameshwari be ever reunited with her son?

Title: 298. Strongroom
description: Bank robbery goes awry, manager and cashier locked in vault. Robbers return after failed rescue attempt, race against time to free hostages before police arrive.

Title: 299. Pontius Pilate
description: The events that culminated with the Passion of Christ seen from the perspective of Pontius Pilate, the Procurator of Judea who unwillingly condemned Christ to death. Based on the biblical Gospel of John.

Title: 300. Gusarskaya ballada
description: A young girl decides to join a Husar squadron and fight against Napoleon. Dressed as a man she has a hard time adjusting to the rude Husar life styles.

Title: 301. Robbery at 3 O'clock
description: Galindo works in a bank. One day he convinces the other employees in the bank to plan a hold-up in the bank they are working. They prepare everything carefully. However, real robbers come just before the fake ones.

Title: 302. Main Shadi Karne Chala
description: The film is set in the beautiful Kashmir. Deepak(I S Johar) has a Photo Studio on a Houseboat in Jhelum river, along with his friend Raja(Rajendranath). Deepak loves Seema (Sayeeda Khan) a daughter of Janakidas (Badri Prasad) and Jankibai (Durga Khote). When Deepak goes to Janakidas with the marriage proposal, he is flatly refused- the reason being that Seema-the youngest of the five sisters-can not get married unless her four elder sisters get married. So, Seema and Deepak decide to first fix their marriages. All these sisters are of different tastes. Vidya (Praveen Chaudhary) is a writer and Language specialist, the next Menaka (Tabassum) is a Dancer, the next is Ragini (Malika) who is a Singer and the last Lily (Mumtaz) is a Sports person. All of them want husbands of their tastes only. After many comedy episodes, Deepak and Seema find grooms- Prakash (Prem Chopra), Ashok (Vivek), Kewal (Firoz Khan) and Raja (Rajendra Kumar). The girls also agree to marry them. However Kewal announces that he has a widowed sister Shyama (Manju) and that she has to get married first before Kewal. All the pairs now start looking for a groom for Shyama. Meanwhile, there is some misunderstanding between Seema and Deepak and Seema goes away from the house into a hailstorm and snow. Deepak finds her out and save her from a landslide. Meanwhile Shyama also gets a groom. All the six marriages take place in one Pandal and at one time only. Prem chopra looks very cute in this film, much before he established himself as a Villain and saying..." Mera naam hai Prem...Prem Chopda". Feroz Khan, Mumtaz and her sister Malika (who later married the wrestler and film Hero Randhawa-brother of Dara Singh ) look very young and charming in this film.

Title: 303. Safe at Home!
description: Legendary Hall of Famer Mickey Mantle stars with his Yankee teammate Roger Maris in this good-natured story of dreams that really do come true.

Title: 304. Me, Grandma, Iliko and Ilarion
description: Grandma Olgha up-brings orphan Zurikela in poverty. Their struggle for life is being relieved by support of their kind neighbors, Iliko and Ilarion, whose merit is the exceptional sense of humor.

Title: 305. Le glaive et la balance
description: Three young men are suspected of kidnapping and murdering a little boy. Most likely, two of them are really involved, but one is not. Neither the police nor the court can decide how to solve that puzzle.

Title: 306. Caesar the Conqueror
description: Julius Caesar leads the Roman army to battle against rebels in Gaul.

Title: 307. The Elusive Corporal
description: An upper-class corporal from Paris is captured by the Germans when they invade France in 1940. Assisted and accompanied by characters as diverse as a morose dairy farmer, a waiter, a myopic intellectual, a working-class Parisian, and a German dental assistant, the corporal tries to escape from prison camps, sometimes making it a few yards, sometimes reaching the French border.

Title: 308. On the Beat
description: Norman wants to be a policeman like his father was, but he fails the height test (amongst others). One day, he gets out his father's old uniform and walks the beat. This leads to a level of chaos that only Norman could cause.

Title: 309. Redhead
description: A redhead, approaching forty, is bored with her husband and with life in general. Having an affair with another man fails to produce the excitement she is craving. So she leaves Germany, seeking adventure and fulfillment in Venice, where she finds work in a hotel. Initially, life seems more interesting, and she has new romantic adventures. But when she realizes that her British lover is merely using her for a personal vendetta against a German Nazi, she finds herself running away once again.

Title: 310. Sweet Violence
description: Olivier, a handsome but callow and moody young student, picks up an enthusiastic actress during a theatre rehearsal, and is introduced to her acquaintances -- a group of jaded rich kids who spend their time storming around the Riviera harassing passersby, throwing wild parties and following all the latest trends. When sexy Elke gives him the eye, he leaves the actress in the lurch and joins the gang for a decadent party aboard a yacht. However, Elke's wanton ways and Olivier's inexperience do not mesh. Charlie accidentally sets the yacht afire. The gang wreaks its vengeance by luring him into a dangerous contest of bravura on a construction site.

Title: 311. Anpadh
description: A wealthy, pampered and illiterate woman faces many challenges after her marriage.

Title: 312. The Horizontal Lieutenant
description: A luckless army intelligence lieutenant finds himself stationed on a remote island army outpost during World War II, where all the action is between the sheets.

Title: 313. A Night to Remember
description: Seventeen years after the atomic bomb was dropped on Hiroshima, a newspaper reporter looks for the bomb's effects, but everyone seems to have forgotten.

Title: 314. A Prize of Arms
description: A criminal gang sets out to pull off the heist of a large army payroll.

Title: 315. The Hustlers
description: This film captures the criminal behavior of two young Copacabana thugs (the "cafajestes"). The two plan a blackmail coup against a rich old man, using nude pictures of a lady on a deserted beach. But things don't always happen as planned.

Title: 316. Han, Hun, Dirch og Dario
description: Poul Borg neglects his young, beautiful wife Marianne. He even forget their wedding day, in favor of a new fast sports car, a beautiful silver-gray Jaguar. During his drive, he runs out of gas. A young lady Laura Lublinski helps him.

Title: 317. Half Ticket
description: A diamond thief hides his loot on an innocent child, but the child turns out to be an adult posing as a youngster to purchase a half-priced train ticket. Now, the thief will have to outwit the eccentric in a series of wacky misadventures.

Title: 318. Eighteen in the Sun
description: The film follows Nicole Molino, a French teenager on vacation at the Italian resort island of Ischia. She meets several other young Italian men also on vacation and looking for fun and romance. Confusion, comedy and romance ensue.

Title: 319. Il mare
description: A well known actor comes to off-season Capri to unwind and meets a teenaged boy. The attraction is immediate and mutual but before their relationship can get off the ground, an alluring woman with a spontaneous sexuality and care free attitude joins the triangle and the boy is slowly pushed out of the picture.

Title: 320. Kohlhiesels Töchter
description: Landlord Kohlhiesel has two daughters that couldn't be more different: Liesel, the older one, is a clumsy hoyden; Gretel (Gritli), the younger, is pretty and charming. Gretel wants to marry, but her father won't allow it until Liesel has a husband. Can Xaver be persuaded to simulate some interest in her?

Title: 321. Chiragh Jalta Raha
description: A headteacher opposes a greedy politician's attempt to forcibly marry his daughter to the headteacher's son. This sparks a chain of events involving relocation, kidnapping, imprisonment, and eventual downfall of the corrupt politician.

Title: 322. Night of Evil
description: The story of a young girl who goes from being a high school cheerleader to a stripper who commits an armed robbery.

Title: 323. Una vita violenta
description: Tommaso Puzzilli is a boy who grew up in the suburb of Pietralata outside Rome. Not having a job, Tommaso and his friends are committing crimes to make money.

Title: 324. Play It Cool
description: Stars Billy Fury (Britain's answer to Elvis Presley) and features cameos from some other stars from the sixties, with Bobby Vee, Helen Shapiro and Shane Fenton (better known as Alvin Stardust). On a plane is Billy and his band on their way to take part in a song contest, also on board is Ann Bryant, who's been abroad by her wealthy father, to stop her infatuation with popstar Larry Granger. The plane is forced to return to the airport and Billy and his band persuade Ann to join them and together they search London's nightclubs for Larry.

Title: 325. Trial and Error
description: An incompetent barrister is assigned to defend an accused wife murderer.

Title: 326. Daughter of the Sun
description: When she is discovered to be a nudist, a school teacher is called before the board of education to defend herself. A young male teacher decides to accompany her to her nudist camp to find out for himself exactly what goes on there.

Title: 327. Killer Whale
description: A fishing village is terrorized by a giant whale, and the fishermen are determined to kill it. A Japanese variation of the "Moby Dick" story.

Title: 328. Lad: A Dog
description: A Wonder dog wins the hearts of a young child and saves his owners from danger.

Title: 329. The Playboy of the Western World
description: A quiet little village, and especially a pretty young woman, fall under the spell of a charming, somewhat roguish stranger who suddenly appears one day, captivating everyone when he claims he murdered his father.

Title: 330. Ouranos
description: The experiences and suffering of a band of Greek soldiers during the 1939-45 war.

Title: 331. O Dimos apo ta Trikala
description: Claiming that he and his brother, Dimos, are like two peas in a pod, a womanising husband puts the blame on him when his wife discovers a compromising photograph. Now, he has a lot of explaining to do. Is he or Dimos the man in the photo?

Title: 332. Obedience
description: Documents the famous Milgram experiment, which measured the willingness of test subjects to obey authority in ways contrary to their own judgment and conscience.

Title: 333. Ibu mertuaku
description: A wealthy matriarch disowns her daughter for marrying a musician. Their marriage struggles due to finances, but when the daughter seeks help, tragedy unfolds.

Title: 334. His Days Are Numbered
description: A middle-aged plumber quits his job and questions his life after seeing somebody his own age suddenly die from a heart attack on his way to work.

Title: 335. Tom Thumb and Little Red Riding Hood
